{"step_by_step_thinking": "Intrusion is a type of tooth movement in orthodontics where the tooth is moved vertically into the bone. The center of rotation during this movement is typically at the center of resistance of the tooth, which is located approximately at the middle third of the root. Therefore, the center of rotation during intrusion is not at infinity, not at the CEJ, and not outside the tooth.", "answer_choice": "B. Middle third of tooth"}
